reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Clever plot and great writing
reviews.reviewText: Brilliant, well written story set in the near future. As I read the first half of the book, I had no idea where it was going. The second half was full of surprises. No spoilers in this review; you'll need to read it for yourself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very interesting premise!
reviews.reviewText: This is much different than I was anticipating and I was intrigued by the sci-fi elements. I would recommend it to others! It was a quick read and it was quite enjoyable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: {3.5 stars}Sometime in the future, bringing people back from the dead is a reality. We don’t get the specifics, but people who have died can be cloned, and their memories returned to them with the exception of their death. Lou is one of those who have returned. It was reported that she was the victim of a notorious serial killer and we see her try to grapple with what happened to her and identify with the other survivors. The book is mostly about a new mother and her relationships, as well as the recovery from trauma. As she tries to get all the information she can about her death, she realizes that there may be more to the story.This was a ‘like,’not a ‘love’ read for me. As someone who is not a mother, I feel like I have read way too many books where postpartum and the exploration of what it is to be a new mother is a theme. I don’t want to say that it doesn’t work for me, but perhaps that I am just a bit tired of it. I really liked the murder mystery parts, and the exploration of a serial killer. The survivors group, and the game re-creating the murder were pretty interesting. But the twist was a bit of a letdown for me. But I think that might be a me thing rather than it just being a boring or disappointing twist. I still enjoyed the telling of the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Different take on murder mystery
reviews.reviewText: The story is well written and kept my attention throughout the whole story . It did take some unexpected twists that kept me glued to the story

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars An Engaging Page Turner
reviews.reviewText: This mystery has an excellent and clever plot and the well written main character keeps the reader engaged throughout. The idea of a murdered person being replaced by a clone—with all the deceased’s memories intact—is beautifully and believably presented (with plenty of the reader’s willing suspension of disbelief) and the novel never falters in its premise. The reluctance of the protagonist’s baby to accept her new mother is a poignant thread throughout. The suspense builds expertly as the protagonist gathers more clues regarding her murder. However, I gave the book only four stars because the ending is shaky. It comes rather abruptly, relies too much on the exposure of a conspiracy and, most importantly, rests ultimately on the premise that (spoiler alert!) a loving mother would walk away from her child.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First novel I enjoyed reading this year. It’s weird and wacky and captivating.I can’t wait to read more novels from the author

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This storyline was awesome and ends with a twist. The writing style is often hard to follow and you have to read paragraphs over to get what just happened. But overall, it's an awesome story and it could be a great movie.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: If the writing and characters in this interesting twisty story had been more compelling I may have enjoyed it. However, I ended up disliking it. I felt deceived. An unreliable narrator can be revelatory. This reveal just made me feel tricked. If it had been more enticing to read it with more attention I might have enjoyed deciphering the clues but frankly it wasn't so I didn't bother.I read this for a sci fi book group otherwise I never would have picked it up as I am not a fan of mysteries. It was marketed as similar to The Echo Wife which is everything this one is not: compelling, thoughtful, deeply critical of marriage and motherhood, brutally feminist, gut wrenchingly honest in its betrayals.My Murder is just meh. It takes ambiguity to a new low.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have to say I went into this book thinking it would be a normal twisty thriller. It isn’t. Yes there is thrills and twists, but actually it is a beautiful story about what makes us who we are, about motherhood, about love and about identity. Just brilliant. I loved it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I thought this was a fascinating and terrifying premise, dead women being cloned after being murdered by the same serial killer. The dead women meet in a support group, building relationships with one another and spending time with their living family too. It took me a while to warm up to the writing style, but I thought the concept was unique and terrifying.3.5 stars rounded up

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Overall great story but wasn't keen on the style of writing
reviews.reviewText: I loved the premise of this book. I'm not big into sci-fi so it was a bit different for me, but liked that the sci-fi element wasn't too far fetched and still comprehendible.However I did find parts of the books dragged out far too long and I didn't really form a bond with the protagonist or any of the other characters. I didn't find the style of writing overly engaging so would end up skim reading bits that I felt were long winded.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Really interesting concept and an enjoyable read.
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the book and found the concept interesting and gripping. However, I felt the ending was a bit of an anti climax after all the earlier promise, hence 4 stars but I would still thoroughly recommend the book.
